item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

15 fixed it,

I was like c-1 ? wtf is c1
But i get it now
thanks

item.title: More a question
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

character-q1 =

There are 15 characters (letters/spaces/symbols/whatever) in that. It’s how many characters are between the quotes, in the string.

c-1
h-2
a-3
r-4
a-5
c-6
t-7
e-8
r-9
(-)-10
q-11
1-12
space-13
equal sign-14
space-15

So you would change it to characterfile2.write("character-q1 = ", 0, 15);

Read full topic

item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:2, topic:425945”]They’re substrings. There are 19 characters in the string "character-rating = "

Don’t count the quotes, but DO count spaces.[/quote]
uh I don’t get it

This is what causes my error btw

characterfile2.newLine();
			characterfile2.write("character-q1 = ", 0, 21);
			characterfile2.write(Integer.toString(q1), 0, Integer.toString(q1).length());

They’re substrings. There are 19 characters in the string "character-rating = "

Don’t count the quotes, but DO count spaces.

item.title: More a question
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

This is more a question,
What do these numbers stand for
the 19, 23, 25…

characterfile.newLine();
			characterfile.write("character-rating = ", 0, 19);
			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(rating), 0, Integer.toString(rating).length());
			characterfile.newLine();
			characterfile.write("character-tradeTimer = ", 0, 23);
			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(tradeTimer), 0, Integer.toString(tradeTimer).length());
			characterfile.newLine();
			characterfile.write("character-randomXCoord = ", 0, 25);
			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(randomXCoord), 0, Integer.toString(randomXCoord).length());

Because I got an outofexception error in my run cmd, on the number 21 (which is not copied here i c now)
which makes that my accounts don’t save

Read full topic
